element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm calculates the cost of moving along predefined routes, asuming that the cost is not the same in all directions (anisotropic).

element.name: ROUTES
element.text: A lines layer containing the routes along which the accumulated cost is to be calculated.

element.name: COST
element.text: The cost of crossing each cell when moving in the maximum cost direction.

element.name: COSTDIR
element.text: Values in this layer represents the direction of maximum cost in degrees, counting clockwise from north.

element.name: KFACTOR
element.text: The constant K in the following equation controls the way in which, from the maximum cost value (Fs) and the direction of maximum cost, the cost of moving in any other direction is computed.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: A new vector layer containing the predefined routes. The associated attributes table contains the same fields as the attributes table in the input layer, with two additional fields containing the distance of each route and the cost of moving along it.
